document_title: Stage 2 breast cancer: Symptoms, treatment and prognosis
subsection_content:
Can stage II breast cancer be cured?
After 5 years of treatment, breast cancer patients without recurrence will be considered cured. For stage II breast cancer, the possibility of cure is very high.
Is stage II breast cancer dangerous?
Stage II breast cancer is classified as an early stage. If it responds well to treatment, the 5-year survival prognosis is about 88-93%. This means that most patients with stage II breast cancer can survive 5 years with timely, effective treatment.
What is the chance of breast cancer recurrence after treatment for stage II breast cancer?
In patients receiving breast-conserving therapy, the likelihood of local recurrence is approximately 2% over 10 years. The possibility of local recurrence depends on the characteristics of the tumor, metastatic lymph nodes, resection area, patient age and postoperative radiotherapy treatment technique.
Also depending on tumor characteristics and lymph node metastasis, the risk of recurrence is highest within the first few years after treatment, the recurrence rate after 5 years and 10 years is 11-19%.
Doctor Tran Thi Thien Huong emphasized that for patients diagnosed with stage II breast cancer, the outlook is quite positive because these tumors can still be cured. Patients need to go to reputable hospitals with modern equipment and technology, with an Oncology department, to receive consultation and develop a treatment plan according to an individualized regimen, optimize effectiveness, and help cure the disease. cure disease and improve quality of life.
